description: This beautifully presented two-bedroom duplex apartment combines classic period character with contemporary refinement, set on a peaceful Notting Hill street and benefiting from a private patio. <PARA> Positioned behind an elegant stucco façade on sought-after Clanricarde Gardens, the property is accessed via a charming portico entrance and unfolds across two thoughtfully designed levels. The raised ground floor opens into an impressive reception room, where generous proportions and abundant natural light immediately stand out. A large bay window enhances the sense of space, drawing attention to the decorative cornicing, ornate ceiling rose and rich hardwood flooring. A striking antique marble fireplace provides a focal point, complementing the home’s calm, neutral palette. <PARA> To the rear, sliding glass doors lead through to a sleek, modern kitchen fitted with integrated Miele appliances. A tall sash window overlooks the private patio and neighbouring gardens, creating a tranquil backdrop and a strong connection between indoor and outdoor living. <PARA> The entire first floor is dedicated to the principal bedroom suite, offering a refined and private retreat. The room is defined by its double-height ceiling, herringbone wood flooring and excellent built-in storage, with full-height wardrobes and integrated shelving thoughtfully incorporated into the design. Arched sash windows to either end of the room provide leafy views, while the en suite bathroom is finished with marble-effect tiling and contemporary black fittings for a clean, sophisticated look. <PARA> The second bedroom suite continues the home’s high standard of finish. A skylight and sliding doors opening directly onto the patio flood the room with light, while bespoke wardrobes and a vertical radiator add both practicality and style. The en suite shower room is finished in veined tiling with matte black fixtures, including a rainfall shower and heated towel rail.
